p: Riboflavin (vit B 2) is one of the essential components required in the enzymatically controlled metabolism of nutrients like lipids, carbohydrates, and amino acids ( Choe et al., 2005; Cardoso et al., 2012; Combs, 2012). The amount of vitamin B 2 was maximum for BP (337.68 ± 15.27 μg/100 g) and minimum for BS (272.76 ± 3.60 μg/100 g). Here, the amounts for BP, BH, and BF were statistically insignificant (p = 0.83) but, for BM and BS the change was significant (p = 1.76 × 10 −4), and the amount reduced by 19.22% and 33.47%, respectively. A similar trend was observed by Kadakal et al. (2007) for hot air and sun dried bulgur. Alajaji and El-Adawy (2006) also observed a similar trend between raw and microwave dried chickpea.
